overview: From 2025-10-01 to 2025-11-01, Sendo-labs/frontend had 10 new PRs (9 merged), 0 new issues, and 3 active contributors.

topPRs.title: refactor:  Project structure and update configurations. Moved from react to Nextjs
topPRs.author: Neysixx
topPRs.body:
This pull request migrates the project from a Vite+React app to a Next.js 15 application with Bun as the package manager, introduces Biome for linting and formatting, and updates the overall project structure and configuration files. It also removes legacy files and dependencies related to the previous stack. The changes modernize the codebase, improve developer experience, and set up new conventions for code quality and workflow.
From React / TailwindV3 / Javascript to Nextjs / TailwindV4 / Typescript.

**Migration to Next.js and Bun:**

* Migrated from Vite+React to Next.js 15, updating `package.json` scripts, dependencies, and project name to `sendo`, and switched to Bun as the package manager. Legacy dependencies and scripts were removed.
* Added `next.config.ts` for Next.js configuration and updated the project entry points accordingly.
* Updated `README.md` to Next.js boilerplate and added `CLAUDE.md` for project guidance, architecture, and workflow documentation. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-b335630551682c19a781afebcf4d07bf978fb1f8ac04c6bf87428ed5106870f5L1-R36) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-6ebdb617a8104a7756d0cf36578ab01103dc9f07e4dc6feb751296b9c402faf7R1-R173)

**Linting, Formatting, and Code Quality:**

* Introduced Biome for linting and formatting with a comprehensive `biome.json` configuration, replacing ESLint and Prettier. ESLint config and related dependencies were removed. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2bc8a1f5e9380d5a187a4e90f11b4dd36c3abad6aea44c84be354a4f44cdec55R1-R70) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-a32a0887ed9d1d707bbb3b845b7df7fd40e673c47e7b60a3ebd896b68d3b8839L1-L38)
* Added a Husky pre-commit hook to automatically format code using Biome before each commit.

**Project Structure and Configuration:**

* Updated `components.json` for shadcn/ui registry, enabling RSC and TSX support, and set up Tailwind CSS 4 integration.
* Migrated postcss configuration to `postcss.config.mjs` for Tailwind CSS 4 compatibility.
* Removed legacy configuration files: `jsconfig.json`, `postcss.config.js`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-7fe0ab2d61296b5df4add971654584ba7ee8082cc5b79ffa3b60da0ed9f0b3ebL1-L10) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-05ed1c7f99e45b485708115502a1e0f28c8547e9a9a29c1b8664f79103cf7873L1-L6)

**Removal of Legacy and Unused Files:**

* Deleted legacy Vite/React files and Base44 SDK integrations: `index.html`, `src/App.jsx`, `src/api/base44Client.js`, `src/api/entities.js`, `src/api/functions.js`, `src/api/integrations.js`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-0eb547304658805aad788d320f10bf1f292797b5e6d745a3bf617584da017051L1-L13) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-d274a54187c91ba0f532df2a9e194e27ab50e988f5e4c33f5a7893918320c661L1-L14) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-4b22c2630841e851e970815e1fb90a121b7165c7e36fc6420f68304f6f33b16fL1-L8) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-cd055a0eba7b6c82d81e037992e9f2676bc3013ec97bd37ca68a721b92616b76L1-L7) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-049ece780362020de9333f238c2de10cbf2457449ea61f36a02d75126cea9b98L1-L9) [[6]](diffhunk://#diff-1e1b94e4a7cb3d5571cef08910343d507084b36191f99c957514278cbe6f8545L1-L26)

**Documentation and Guidance:**

* Added detailed project guidance and architecture overview in `CLAUDE.md`, including development commands, environment variables, and technology stack.
* Updated `README.md` to reflect Next.js usage and deployment instructions.

topPRs.title: feat: Add initial project setup with Eliza integration
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
- Created .env.example for server configuration.
- Introduced CLAUDE.md for development guidance.
- Modified package.json to include Eliza API dependencies.
- Developed hooks for Eliza agent and chat management.
- Created UI components for chat interface and markdown rendering.
- Refactored Agent page to utilize Eliza agent data.

topPRs.title: feat: improve pages structure in order to anticipate a better data recovery strategy
topPRs.author: Neysixx
topPRs.body: Refactor pages structure to fit with Nextjs best practice. For the moment, we just display mocked data, but in the next PRs, we are going to use real fetched user data from the agent. With Nextjs, the data fetching must be done on serverside and passed as props to client components (+ security and + fast)

completedItems.title: refactor: worker-plugin
completedItems.body:
- Updated label elements in the RuleBuilder component to enhance readability by breaking long lines into multiple lines.
- Ensured consistent formatting for label attributes across different rule types, improving overall code clarity.

completedItems.title: refactor: removed 'accepted' status from ActionHistory component to simplify action status handling and improve clarity in the UI.

topContributors.summary: standujar: Focused on bootstrapping several new projects and plugins this month, merging multiple foundational pull requests. They established the initial implementation for the CryptoScore plugin (Sendo-labs/plugin-cryptoscore#1), the frontend project (Sendo-labs/frontend#2), and the Sendo Worker (Sendo-labs/plugin-sendo-worker#1). The Sendo Worker PR was particularly significant, introducing over 13,000 lines of code to establish the new service. This activity shows a primary focus on new feature work and initial project configuration.

Neysixx: This month, Neysixx led a foundational overhaul of the `Sendo-labs/frontend` repository, merging six pull requests focused on restructuring and feature development. Their most impactful contribution was a massive project-wide refactor to update the structure and configurations (Sendo-labs/frontend#1), which involved over 34,000 line changes. In addition, they implemented new pages (Sendo-labs/frontend#7), improved the page structure (Sendo-labs/frontend#3), and resolved a critical build issue by adding missing dependencies (Sendo-labs/frontend#5). This work demonstrates a clear focus on large-scale refactoring and feature implementation within the frontend codebase.

xdrkush: Focused on establishing the new `Sendo-labs/sendo-api` repository, merging two pull requests. Their most significant contribution was the initial commit of the project (PR #1), which introduced over 21,000 lines of code. They also resolved a bug related to the buy/sell account functionality in PR #3, demonstrating a focus on both foundational work and bug fixes.

M4XGO focused on establishing and improving development infrastructure this month by creating a foundational set of reusable workflows and release management processes in Sendo-labs/reusable-workflows#1, a significant effort involving over 1000 lines of new code. They then applied this new system to enable automated release management and NPM publishing for the plugin-cryptoscore repository (Sendo-labs/plugin-cryptoscore#2). This work was concentrated entirely on configuration and documentation files, reflecting a clear focus on developer tooling and automation.

0xCanet: This month, 0xCanet's work was centered on the foundational setup of the new `Sendo-labs/frontend` repository. They merged a single, substantial pull request (Sendo-labs/frontend#1), which introduced the initial codebase for the project. This commit added over 9,200 lines of code across 111 files, establishing the new frontend application.

0domart: This month, 0domart focused on developing new functionality in the Sendo-labs/spotlight repository. They opened a significant pull request (#1) to implement SOL transfer logic and its corresponding unit tests. This work-in-progress involved a substantial effort, with over 1500 new lines of code added across 12 files, indicating a primary focus on building out test suites.

tionebDotsamapha: Focused on improving project documentation this month, merging a pull request (#2) to update the README file to English in the Sendo-labs/sendo-api repository. This contribution represented their sole activity, with all changes concentrated on documentation.
